name: London Bridge Resort

reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit. The room was a comfortable upscale resort room for two adults. But it would have been small for 4 adults and impossible for the advertised "sleeps 6". The room size was only about 600 sq ft with two queen beds and a mini kitchen that was lacking in counter space. Positives: convenient location and super nice staff.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: I was visiting my parents for a surprise birthday for my mom, & the entire staff at the London Bridge Resort was very helpful, They even helped in planning a few surprises for her. Everyone that works at this resort from the front desk staff to the handymen where very friendly. We were told about places to visit while we were on vacation, as well as great places to eat. We were also introduced to the GM, who was just as nice as his staff..
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at London Bridge Resort is wonderful and went way out of their way to make our stay a wonderful one. We were notified of the death of a dear friend as we arrived for our two day stay. There were no rooms available for a few hours and It was also my birthday. Keela at the front desk sent us to places close by to kill the time. She also sent chocolates and a hand written letter to our room and a bottle of champagne. The room was clean and plenty of ammenaties. The lake has so many things to do right our the back door of the resort. We kayaked, walked the boardwalk along the lake and took the ferry over to CA each night to look at the Christmas lights. The food and service was excellent at Martini Bay. Everyone was friendly and we will go back!
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, scenery and facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at London Bridge Resort are fantastic! The staff went out of their way to make our stay wonderful and relaxing. Keela at the front desk leaned we just lost a dear friend in a plane crash the day we checked in. She also found out it was my birthday. She sent champagne and chocolates and a card to our room! The room had an excellent view and everything we wanted to do was right out their back door. We kayaked, walked the boardwalk and the ferry ride is only $2 to to to CA for dinner or gambling. The Christmas lights are wonderful over the lake and bridge. The rooms were clean and the staff at Martini Bay were very friendly! We will go back next year!
reviews.title: Friendly Staff and wonderful facilities/views!

reviews.text: Lots to do and yet easy to just relax at the pool or walk through the shops at English Village. The water tube slide is a nice feature in the lower pool. The hot tub is just the right temp for me. There is an exercise room with quite a bit of equipment if you do that sort of thing. There is a nice executive golf course that gives discounts to the guests. Lots of good resturaunts in the area and also fast food. In & Out is a two minute walk.
reviews.title: relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used a timeshare exchange to stay here. Lake Havasu is a really nice, clean place to visit. If you have a boat, it is great but we are not boaters. The resort is in a great location right next to the London Bridge. The walk over the bridge is very easy and there are so many nice restaurants in the area. The one bedroom unit was very large but did not have an oven--just a toaster oven. The bed was nice and decor appropriate. I would stay here if we ever go back to Lake Havasu.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this resort for its location viewing the London Bridge. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful. The resort itself was beautiful as was our room. That's where the kudos end. We could hear every word of the conversations going on outside our door. Even on the 2nd floor we could hear people talking in the parking lot. The resort held a Halloween party and the people attending insisted on standing in the parking lot yelling, cussing and playing loud music until 4 AM. We called the front desk twice asking them to do something. They sent security out and the people quieted down, then the next wave came. We chose this particular time of year (end of October) as we thought it would be less crowded and noisy. I would be hard pressed to recommend this resort or return!
reviews.title: Incredibly Noisy!

reviews.text: First time to the states it happened that we landed in lake havasu. allthough it was off season, it was a great time coming from vegas to relay next to the beautiful lake havasu. The hotel is best located just next to the london bridge. there is a bar, breakfast area, pizza restaurant etc. right next to it. Pool is not the best i ve seen but its okay. we spent most of the time any way down at the lake. at the beach next to the park od on the lake with jet skies or boats. the hotel itself is very nice, the rooms are practical and each with a quite big kitchenette and we had one main bedroom as well as a big sofabed in the living room. bathroom is very nice and typical american style. there is a big parking place just in front of the hotel and restaurants are very close aswell. just a short walking distance away. the price is absolutly fair but I guess in main season it will be more expensive.
reviews.title: Welcome to Paradies :-))

reviews.text: the staff is very friendly and helpfull. absolutly no complaints - good choice!!
reviews.title: Fantasic stay.

reviews.text: After reading the reviews did not know what to expect. We stayed on a timeshare exchange. 10/12/12 thru 10/19/12. We had a great room 3rd floor looking directly at the London Bridge. The room very clean an comfortable. The staff very friendly and accomadating. Great happy hour at Martini Bay resturant. Guess. at the resort get discount at Martini Bay also. The resort did everything to accomadate you also offered free limo service. I can understand how it would get crazy there win the disco Kokamo is open.(spring breakers). The disco just closed for the winter reopens in March 2013.
reviews.title: A lot to do, even without a boat

reviews.text: Best hotel in Lake Havasu, They all are so welcoming, it was so pleasant walking around and having all the employee's say hello and made sure we had everything we needed.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and beds very comfortable. And Martini Bay makes some great martinis. Looking forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: AWESOME

reviews.text: Beautiful Hotel, wonderful service. All the little shops outside, are fun to go in and see all the merchandise they have to sell. The swimming pool is great. Walking along the river is breath taking. The tempertures are so nice, the people are very pleasant. Recommend this hotel to everyone going to Lake Havasu. Looking forward to going back!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with excellent customer service & phenomenal water slide/pool!

reviews.text: The manager of this hotel is outstanding & did everything she could to make our stay wonderful! The rooms were impeccable & all of the staff were very friendly. You cannot get a better view of the London Bridge than from this hotel! We will definitely be back:)
reviews.title: Paradise by the Lake!

reviews.text: WOW! What a great place! The room was spacious, the staff was friendly, and everything very clean! i WILL DEFINITELY COME HERE AGAIN!
reviews.title: Here we are again

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights during the hot air Balloon festival & the place was sold out for the weekend. Booked our room using Expedia & thought for the price we paid, we'd have a much better room than we did. Having read others' descriptions of their experience here and having seen the room next to ours, I have to conclude the rooms can be very different which would affect your experience. I booked a studio suite and didn't realize or perhaps didn't read the description carefully enough that they contain Murphy beds! So I was very surprised when I was told this at reception & that we would have to pull it out ourselves. This wasn't too difficult but it required 2 of us to do it. I don't know how 1 person would manage it unless you have very long arms to reach the breadth of a Queen bed. The picture on their website of a suite certainly wasn't of our room because when we pulled the bed out, there was barely any space between the end of the bed & the couch. Our room# was 2053. I just prayed I didn't have to get up during the night because I would have fallen over the couch, stubbed my toes on the Murphy frame and had a serious accident getting to the bathroom. We also had to move the bar chairs into the hallway at night so we would have more space around the bed. And our room overlooked the parking lot, not the river which was a drag. The space behind the bed had never been vacuumed (or at least not in years) because there was a lot of dirt there. The furniture & cupboards were tired and worn. The TV was small & looked like it was from the 1980's. Except for some very noisy guests in the parking lot & in the hallway at night, it was quiet so that was a plus.
reviews.title: Really depends on your room

reviews.text: The reception area was dark & smelled very strongly of something floral which made me sneeze each time I passed through it. Despite the replica of the Royal Coach, it was a very dreary reception area.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have to leave the hotel to walk outdoors to a cafe for breakfast. Depending on which part of the hotel you stay in, this could be a bit of a trek. For us, it was fairly close. Breakfast was OK; typical of chain hotels so nothing elaborate but it did have both cold & hot items.
reviews.title: Aging, but still nice place to stay in Lake Havasu

reviews.text: The location is very central & in our case because we were there for the Balloon festival, it was very close to the island where most of the balloons launched. And since the hotel is right by London Bridge & the river & close to Havasu Lake, we didn't even bother driving to the Island to see the balloons on the last day of the festival since we have great views from the rear of the hotel. There is a lovely riverside trail by the hotel. I've stayed a far worse places but I certainly would not rate this hotel highly, especially given how much we had to pay for the tiny room we had.
reviews.title: rather interesting hotel!

reviews.text: We come every year with a motorcyce group and this hotel pleases everyones expectations which is hard to to with so many peoples tastes. The hotel is located right next to the London Bridge and within walking distance to several resturants, bars and movie theater. We had a 3 floor room overlooking the water with a balcony, 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. It was very clean and comfortable. The Blue Martini bar and restaurant are on property, the view is gorgeous, food is great and prices reasonable. It rained during our stay this year so we did not use the pool, and stayed in the area instead of taking a ride. The hotel took several of our group to get a rental car and offered to drive us anywhere we needed. The staff is great and accomodating.
reviews.title: A bit tired

aka: London Bridge Hotel Lake Havasu City
description: London Bridge Resort is an All-Suite Waterfront Resort and is poised along the Colorado River and Lake Havasu. London Bridge Resort is situated on 110 beautiful waterfront acres, adjacent to the London Bridge and the Bridgewater Channel. The resort features 3 swimming pools, Splash Pool and Waterslide, restaurants, bars, fitness center, and complimentary Wi-Fi. Daily hot breakfast is included. The resort is centrally located in the heart of Lake Havasu nearby restaurants, shopping, theaters, nightlife, and entertainment. Located nearby are boat and watercraft rentals, fishing guides, lake and desert tours, championship golf, and Nevada-style gaming.
